instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2327: What is 820-2327? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5_REG: What is PP3V3_S5_REG? PP3V3_S5_REG is a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a doesnt turn on, nothing on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_REG</SIGNAL>, <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> no enable sig
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a doesnt turn on, nothing on 3v3s5, <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> has nothing on entrip (pin 6) for 3v3s5, resistor on entrip line is (<RESISTOR>R7272</RESISTOR>), problem is the schematic shows this resistor to be 57.6k, im getting a reading of 75k, BUT on the same model board that is working, on that same resistor i get a reading of just 3.1 ohms,

What i think I know: that pin 6 on <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> (<SIGNAL>3V3S5_ENTRIP</SIGNAL>) is an enable signal telling <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> to turn on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_REG</SIGNAL>.... is this correct?
what i dont understand is if the resistor on that entrip line is supposed to be 57.6k, and on my bad board its 75K, yet on a good board its only 3.1 ohm....
is the schematic wrong or am i missing something serious?
*I'm new at this and I havent yet successfully fixed a board, I've watched a shitton of Louis's videos and am still learning...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a doesnt turn on, nothing on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_REG</SIGNAL>, <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> no enable sig
threads.message: Basics first. Green light present? PPBUS voltage?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a doesnt turn on, nothing on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_REG</SIGNAL>, <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> no enable sig
threads.message:
yes green light, ppbus voltage is 4v 
also <CAPACITOR>C7280</CAPACITOR> was short and getting hot originally, i replaced it

threads.message: changed the fuse f7000 and now i get proper voltage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, still no power, will advise

threads.message: fuckin turns on now!!! HOT DAMN I FIXED ONE!!! LOL
